issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Per DOC-819, it would also help to not have euca-modify-property print out any information regarding the use of "-f", since its not clearly documented.

Currently if you run "euca-modify-property --help", the following is displayed:

{code}
 euca-modify-property --help
Usage: euca-modify-property [options]

Modify a cloud property or setting

Options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -p PROPERTY, --property=PROPERTY
                        set a property (format: PROPERTY=VALUE)
  -f PROPERTY_FROM_FILE, --property-from-file=PROPERTY_FROM_FILE
                        set a property using the contents of a file as its
                        value (format: PROPERTY=FILE)
  -r PROPERTY_TO_RESET, --property-to-reset=PROPERTY_TO_RESET
                        reset a property to its default value

  Standard Options:
    -D, --debug         Turn on all debugging output
    --debugger          Enable interactive debugger on error
    -U URL, --url=URL   Override service URL with value provided
    --region=REGION     Name of the region to connect to
    -I ACCESS_KEY_ID, --access-key-id=ACCESS_KEY_ID
                        Override access key value
    -S SECRET_KEY, --secret-key=SECRET_KEY
                        Override secret key value
    --version           Display version string
{code}
fields.summary: Remove -f option from "help" printout of euca-modify-property

comments.body: Thanks for opening this [~hspencer].  [~graziano], I'll leave it to you to set the benefit for this one and rank it accordingly in the Sustaining Backlog.

I'd like to suggest removing the functionality.  The way it works is highly misleading and I suggest we ditch it or fix it. 

Currently the way -f behaves is just terribly pointless, since you still have to script around it.  I'm recommending euca-modify-property -p with readline from a file.  It does exactly the same job.

[~kedwards], no worries.  If anything its really to help push this one along since customers are talking about it.  [~hspencer] tells me that removing the option completely may not be possible since we use this internally, despite it being broken.
Retrieving a property value from a file is a crucial part of euca-configure-vmware.  We cannot simply remove that functionality.

So should the fix be in euca-configure-vmware here?  The reason I say this is because it seems completely broken in the way it works:

{code}
$ cat property.test
jeevanullas@gmail.com

$ euca-modify-property -f bootstrap.notifications.email_from=property.test

PROPERTY bootstrap.notifications.email_from jeevanullas@gmail.com was notification@eucalyptus
{code}

... so for multiple properties there has to be some code/logic to iterate across properties anyhow.

That option isn't a shortcut for setting lots of properties at once.  It does exactly what its help output says it does:  setting a property using the contents of a file as the property's value.  Can you think of a less confusing way to describe what it does?
The description suggests its used for defining lots of key=value properties in a file.  This is precisely how an administrator will assume it works.

Both I and the other administrators I worked with in the past failed to come up with a way to interpret the description that way, but no matter.  If I get to rework the admin tools during this cycle then moving things around, renaming them, and so forth should be possible, but until that happens we're pretty much stuck with it.  If you can come up with a better description that we can use for now then I am happy to add it.

[~gholms] I wasn't aware that you were an administrator ;) Multiple customers have complained about this, I better go tell them that they aren't administrators and they haven't got a clue what they're talking about. 

I'd suggest stating that this takes a "single key=value line" in a file, something which illustrates that this does not take *multiple* key=value statements.

Don't be too eager to generalize.  If enough people tend to interpret it that way then it should be fixed to be more clear.  8^)

That option doesn't actually take _any_ {{key=value}} lines in a file -- it takes a {{key=file}} argument at the command line, opens up the file you named there, and uses the entirety of that file as the property's value.  That is, if you have a file named {{myfile}} whose contents say {{hello}}, then {{\-f foo=myfile}} is equivalent to {{\-p foo=hello}}.

Any other ideas?

Help output updated in commit 1c32686.  Run {{euca-modify-property --help}} to see the option's new description:

{noformat}
Usage: euca-modify-property [options] 

Modify a cloud property or setting

Options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -p PROPERTY, --property=PROPERTY
                        set a property (format: PROPERTY=VALUE)
  -f PROPERTY_FROM_FILE, --property-from-file=PROPERTY_FROM_FILE
                        read the contents of the given file as the value
                        component of a PROPERTY=VALUE property (format:
                        PROPERTY=FILE)
  -r PROPERTY_TO_RESET, --property-to-reset=PROPERTY_TO_RESET
                        reset a property to its default value

  Standard Options:
    -D, --debug         Turn on all debugging output
    --debugger          Enable interactive debugger on error
    -U URL, --url=URL   Override service URL with value provided
    --region=REGION     Name of the region to connect to
    -I ACCESS_KEY_ID, --access-key-id=ACCESS_KEY_ID
                        Override access key value
    -S SECRET_KEY, --secret-key=SECRET_KEY
                        Override secret key value
    --version           Display version string
{noformat}

Verified:

[root@b-41 ~]# euca-modify-property --help
Usage: euca-modify-property [options]

Modify a cloud property or setting

Options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -p PROPERTY, --property=PROPERTY
                        set a property (format: PROPERTY=VALUE)
  -f PROPERTY_FROM_FILE, --property-from-file=PROPERTY_FROM_FILE
                        read the contents of the given file as the value
                        component of a PROPERTY=VALUE property (format:
                        PROPERTY=FILE)
  -r PROPERTY_TO_RESET, --property-to-reset=PROPERTY_TO_RESET
                        reset a property to its default value

  Standard Options:
    -D, --debug         Turn on all debugging output
    --debugger          Enable interactive debugger on error
    -U URL, --url=URL   Override service URL with value provided
    --region=REGION     Name of the region to connect to
    -I ACCESS_KEY_ID, --access-key-id=ACCESS_KEY_ID
                        Override access key value
    -S SECRET_KEY, --secret-key=SECRET_KEY
                        Override secret key value
    --version           Display version string
[root@b-41 ~]#
